description:
When I run the command "nova boot "，the nova-compute Prompt me that "Got this error 'ascii' codec can't encode characters in position 0-4: ordinal not in range(128)".


who met this problem? please help me 

best thanks!

 >>>>I suspect that this maybe a bug. 



nova-compute.log >>

comments.content:
This is a malformed XML error. Typically this comes from some out of place character being received or transmitted in an XML stream. I do not commonly see this error, but when I do, it has turned out to be some non-ascii character in a command line parameter. It may be a value encoded in the image metadata in glance.

Note: I cannot reproduce this error.

1. show us the nova boot command
2. show us the metadata from glance for the image used (or the command to load the image)
3. tell us the precise version of the driver you are using (this may have been a transient bug I don't see in the current master branch)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hartsock
